handling it and um one way to do that is to give
llms instructions in instead um to give you a recipe of what to do so instead of
the llm doing the data processing the llm uh job is just to do the natural language processing and turn that query
into basically a stack of actions that you're going to do deterministically uh which could look
something like this so you might have a query that asks you to show inflation rates for Greece by dates for for 20 uh
from 2022 you might have some metadata or or even your entire data that when you're sending this over to the llm and

greater than or equal to 2022 you might be sorting by the date column and so
on uh and what we've found works pretty well actually is not sending the data set at all but sending um metadata about
the data and that's actually enough to do quite a lot uh with this kind of approach so we can send over the names
of the columns we can send over the types of the columns uh if it's numeric we we'll typically send over minimum maximum average some
some statistics um if it's a string type column if it's text U we found it's
quite useful to send over a sample of some unique strings perhaps like the 10 first unique strings and that will give
then the llm a better chance at at um interpreting the format of of the
data so by doing that essentially what we're doing is we're we're minimizing the complexity and we're we're solving
